alert.note: Alert for Athens; Morgan; Perry; Vinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Perry, Morgan, northern Vinton and northwestern Athens Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Logan Elm Village, or near Circleville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Nelsonville, New Lexington, Glouster, McConnelsville, Somerset, Shawnee, Chesterhill, Lake Hope State Park, Perry State Forest, Thornport, Harbor Hills, Crooksville, Chauncey, Thornville, Junction City, New Straitsville, Malta, Corning, Buchtel and Stockport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Ohio.
